title: Middle East
text:
Fourteen hours of rainfall have wrought havoc across parts of Tunisia – with overturned cars swept away, flooded buildings, and sink holes.

It's prompted no shortage of angry commentary about the country's poor drainage system and infrastructure.

But some people have found humour in the chaos, as well as an innovative means of transport:

The video was shot by Seifiddine Bejaoui, just outside his place of work near the Tunis Marine train station, by the city's port.

He works as a driver for a private company and told the BBC they could not move anything today.

Seifiddine said "these were guys from the area having fun… I don't know who they are, but we were just having a laugh about it all. So, despite the floods, it's been a fun day!"
